title: If assasins are intended to have delayed burst marksmen need delayed sustain
body:
Sanguine Blade generally did not seem to be well liked because it is not as reliable when compared to the flat stats of bloodthirster. But given that marksmen often heal well above 10% of their health with a single auto it might be the hit needed to their sustain as the counter measure to assassins having longer windows required for their burst.

Make sustained damage required to get sustain, make it dependent on a debuff on the target getting stacked 5 times to get maximized lifesteal from any lifesteal item. 

This is not about the damage on the items, only the lifesteal.

I've never been fond of Lifesteal/Spellvamp as a concept in general.  It's fine for a champ's kit component since they're ostensibly paying for it in power budget and can be balanced around it, but being able to itemize for it tends to skew things.  That's why Spellvamp was straight up removed.  If Lifesteal didn't exist, regen and healing Supports would be far more valuable.  

Seeing someone full-heal late game with four auto attacks on some minions is just silly.
dps champs need it in order to be able to outplay burst and still be able to contribute to a fight

> Kog shouldn't be the pinnacle in which we balance ADC's around. He's the outlier, not the base.

Most Marksmen are *far* more self-sufficient than Kog is.  If they get sacked in spite of all their mobility/CC/whatever, then that's on them.

I'll say this, I have no issue with a Marksmen being able to heal up after a skirmish.  I just think that sustain should come from sources outside the Marksmen (healing Supports or healing support items) or from items with real opportunity cost involved (less gimpy HP regen due to the loss of Lifesteal).

Hell, you could even do something *crazy* like creating a Marksmen item that builds out of the Bottle.

Why is healing during combat so wrong? A marksmen is reliant on their team sure, but that reliance ends with peeling off engagers and divers. A team can't always stop an assassin or a mage, but if the ADC is good enough to be able to dodge some vital part of a combo, then they shouldn't be punished for being completely out of a fight regardless, unless they decided to champ select a Healer. 

That's ridiculously dependent on a team, and while that may sound alright for a Kog main as yourself, for Kog to work best, people build entire team comps around him. For that idea you're suggesting to work, you'd have to focus entire teams around keeping your frail carry safe, which discounts what others want to do. Not everyone wants to be a Lulu, or a Peeler for someone else to do the work.

Honestly healing during combat wouldn't be as much of a pain if it wasn't so damn much.  Warwick is a frustrating champ because has an obscene amount of sustain in his kit and he still doesn't heal as much as carries can. Combat sustain should encourage focusing the target, but as it is it basically means you 100-0 instantly or don't bother attacking at all. It limits the playstyles that are viable and forces assassins to either 100-0 or build bruiser. Because Riot has delayed a lot of assassins' burst the amount of healing has now made their jobs even more feast or famine and is going to force even more bruiser builds.

Lifesteal isn't about outplaying burst alone, it's about burst vs poke.

Marksman need to be in aa range for an extended duration to be effective, and need relatively squishy builds to be effective. That's a necessary trade-off for best in game dps (not the only tradeoff).

This means they need to be full hp at the start of a fight, or they'll just get popped before they can contribute (in comparison, a mage can drop a full rotation and die, and still be at least a little useful).

In-combat sustain is a still-important but secondary contribution.

But a more reasonable 15-25% lifesteal average fits this situation perfectly, but adc's nowadays be running 40-70% lifesteal with no legitimate level of tradeoff, and are healing half the damage done to them in middle of a fight.

Its to the point where an adc will be at 10% mid teamfight and your one ability away from dispatching them for your team, then 2 people on the other team keep you cc'd for 2-4 seconds while the adc attack moves behind them and they are back to 50% hp, which means it will take another rotation to bring them down provided you unload that exact second....thats when lifesteal is too much.
